snippet: The head judge of FIFA’s ethics committee said an investigation of the bidding for the 2018 and 2022 World Cups found potential ethics violations but said the voting’s integrity was intact. The conclusions were immediately contested.
abstract: Hans-Joachim Eckert of Germany, head judge of FIFA’s ethics committee, says investigation of bidding for 2018 and 2022 World Cup games found potential ethics violations but that voting integrity is intact; conclusions are immediately contested by former US Attorney Michael Garcia, head of investigatory arm of committee, who vows to bring decision by Eckert to close the case to FIFA's appeals panel.
lead_paragraph: The head judge of FIFA’s ethics committee said an investigation of the bidding for the 2018 and 2022 World Cups found potential ethics violations but said the voting’s integrity was intact. The conclusions were immediately contested.

headline.main: Tuning Out Colleague’s Protests, Judge Clears FIFA World Cup Bidding
headline.print_headline: Tuning Out Colleague’s Protests, Judge Clears World Cup Bidding
